Reviews.Title: Like new exactly as described
Reviews.Author: Tomi Hindman
Reviews.Content: I used to have this phone and i liked it because it has microsoft word.  I was going to go back to this model...but when i activated it all the newest apps available were not applicable to the phone anymore so its really only a "writing tool that I can use that fits in my pocket.  BUT  nice packaging. fast shipping.  I couldn't ask for better service from a vendor than from this one!

Reviews.Title: excellent pictures
Reviews.Author: syeda  aleen hussain
Reviews.Content: i bought this phone last year and still using it. takes beautiful and clear pictures. i take pictures of my 3year old all the time and they always impress me. the only thing i cant figure is how to send images in texting.i have dropped it like three times and it still works fine. call quality is great, i have  Tmobile so I cant say anything about other networks. it only comes with three games though.

Reviews.Title: worst phone ever
Reviews.Author: the truth
Reviews.Content: the htc imagio is a horrible phone.people looking to buy it do not. it looks like a slick phone and it might have a good design but dont let that fool you. there are a lot of hardware issues with this phone i have been using it for 2 years and it was a pain.fun and gamescomes with 2 games:an htc game which is called teeter it is ok and then there is a windows game bubble breaker which is a 1980's game. htc market is extremely small and has only 1 or 2 free games. it has apps but bad ones and 3.99$ apps that suck after a while the market place becomes inaccessiblekeysthe buttons only last for 3 months. if  you press a button too much like the off button, to exit an application, after a while the sticky keys kick in. all the buttons sink in and you have to push it. the button works but it doesn't pop back up. which is a real pain when you want to power on the device and you don't even know if the key is being pushedwindows 6.5it is one of the worst operating systems there is. it crashes if you run 4 or more applications. htc made a very good ui sense looks good and it is good just not on this device. in the email you can only see the 50 newest emails and it is thee worlds biggest pain to send an email.in the 2 years of using it i could only send 4 emails and i would have to us my laptop to do the rest. it is not very customizable either, you cant change the home screens or put applications in the home sreen. you can only change the order of some homesreens.chargeit charges in 2 hours from 20% to 100% but battery runs out so quickly after one year of use i got 10 minutes with the battery while it was on sleep.so i had to buy a whole new battery. the battery first lasted about a day on sleep with 5 or 6 phone calls and if you dont charge it at night it will be dead by morning.screenscreen produces ok images but the camera is horrible which i will talk about later. acquires scratches on a plastic screen. it is not multi touch and is very unresponsivecameraproduces horrible quality and no flashbrowservery slow and flash hardly respondsi finally had to throw out the phone when i put headphones in. i listened to music for a few days and then when i took out the headphones the phone thought that headphones were still in so i couldnt play music through the speaker and then i couldnt hear calls and they coulnt hear me. putting headphones in didnt work either. i could hear them but they coulnt hear me even with headphones with microphonesyou are better of  buying any android phone

ProductInfo.Features:
3.6-inch LCD display
This unlocked cell phone is compatible with GSM carriers like AT&T; and T-Mobile. 3G-enabled touchscreen phone with full onscreen QWERTY keyboard; powered by Windows Mobile 6.5
Wi-Fi networking (802.11b/g); GPS location services; 5-megapixel camera/camcorder, Bluetooth stereo music streaming, MicroSD expansion to 16 GB
Up to 5.3 hours of talk time, up to 324 hours (13.5 days) of standby time
Access V Cast Music (with Rhapsody) and Video services via fast EV-DO data network; GPS-enabled for turn-by-turn directions; Visual Voice Mail; GSM global roaming capabilities.Not all carrier features may be supported. It will not work with CDMA carriers like Verizon Wireless, Alltel and Sprint.
